author: kfogel
msg: Fix issue #697.  URL->WC copy no longer prints checkout summary line.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/copy-cmd.c
(svn_cl__copy): Pass `suppress_final_line' flag to the trace update
editor.

author: kfogel
msg: It's confusing for `svn update' to print "Updated to revision N" when
no changes were received, and your working copy may even have been
entirely at revision N prior to the update.  Make update output print
a different concluding line if no real changes were received:
* subversion/clients/cmdline/trace-update.c
(struct edit_baton): New boolean field `received_some_change'.
(svn_cl__get_trace_update_editor): Initialize it to FALSE.
(delete_entry, add_directory, apply_textdelta, add_file,
change_file_prop, change_dir_prop): Set it to TRUE.
(close_edit): If it's set, print "Updated to revision N", else print
"At revision N".
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/svntest/tree.py
(build_tree_from_checkout, build_tree_from_status): Tighten regular
expressions.

author: sussman
msg: Cleanup of r1888 commit, having been most excellently reviewed by Herr Stein.
* dump.c (struct edit_baton, struct dir_baton): make 'path' a const
char * instead of stringbuf.
(make_dir_baton, get_dump_editor): telescope path using
svn_path_join instead of add_component garbage.  c'mon, man, this is
the age of New Editors.
(dump_node): use APR_SIZE_T_FMT.  Use svn_stream_write instead of
svn_stream_printf if there are no format codes!
(write_revision_record): use SVN_REVNUM_T_FMT and APR_SIZE_T_FMT.
Again, use svn_stream_write where appropriate.
(svn_repos_dump_fs): combine a printf.

author: brane
msg: On Win32, a file can't be deleted if its read-only attribute is set.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/io.c (apr_dir_remove_recursively): Clear the
read-only attribute before removing a file.

author: sussman
msg: Revert my r1884 commit.  It didn't completely fix the bug, and only
made 'svn diff' buggier.  This issue is still assigned to me (#700).
* repos_diff.c : see log message for r1884.  stop prefixing paths for now.
